InstallLocation) \ AppXManifest.xml” + Enter, restart the computer (Recommended), and check again. windows.symptom: Hello, I allowed windows update to install the latest update back on 11/20/19, since the update,  I cannot get past the sign in page        Hello, I allowed windows update to install the latest update back on 11/20/19, since the update, I am unable to sign in to the computer, I cannot get past the sign in page which states that i have no internet, despite being connected via ethernet & wifi, all my other computers have internet connectivity, I am then asked to enter my password, or pin, which are rejected with a message telling me I have no internet, please sign in with other option, all of which are rejected, I enter "last password used on this device" as instructed, only to have that come back as incorrect.. Also, on the log in screen, on the lower right, I have 2 icons: internet and ease of access. there is no power switch iconI have tried every imaginable fix, to no avail, I do not want to reset the computer as I need my filesany advise would be greatly appreciated
solutions: Hi Michael, Most likely, if the sign in is damaged. There's a high chance that you really need to Reset/Refresh your PC. The best thing that I can suggest is to extract your HDD and export all your important files first before doing this procedure.Please let me know if I clarified your concern. Thanks and regards,

Hi Michael, Most likely, if the sign in is damaged. There's a high chance that you really need to Reset/Refresh your PC. The best thing that I can suggest is to extract your HDD and export all your important files first before doing this procedure.Please let me know if I clarified your concern. Thanks and regards, Thanks for the quick advice, how exactly would I extract my HDD and export my files? My PC is  DEll  (2310 I believe) All In One unit

Hi Michael, Most likely, you need a hand over that from a friend that knows how to extract and convert it to an external hard drive or a local shop.This is the first step in order to you to have a successful system restoration. Thanks and regards,

windows.symptom: Recovering files from Word on lost device        Among other items, my Windows computer was stolen in a home burglary. Is there any way I can retrieve the documents from that computer, particularly in Word. They are not in the cloud or onedrive. I got the MS office as a student, if that helps
solutions: Hi Byron. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.When you install Office it offers to place the files in Onedrive so they are always within reach via the internet in cases like these. But you said you didn't do that, correct? So what kind of backup do you have? If it's a System Image backup you can mount it to extract the files that were present when you made that image. But you really need a file backup, and another cloud backup like the one you were offered when you set up Office. In fact Office 365 includes 1tb of free OneDrive storage in addition to the 5gb which already comes free.

Sorry ... bad news: Unless you have a backup somewhere else, your personal files are wherever you were storing them. Microsoft doesn't make a second copy.More bad news ... As much as it burns to be robbed, you may have a bigger problem: the theft of your personal identity.By now, your computer is in the trash. The only part of it that's of any interest to a thief is your hard drive, and not even the hard drive itself but the information you had stored there. Please do this ASAP:Change all your online passwords. Change every one, but particularly for email and financial institutions.Be on the lookout for signs that your identity may be stolen. Work with your insurance company and the local police. Being robbed sucks big time - don't let it suck more than it already has. Best wishes to you.

Your question is like saying "My briefcase was stolen. Is there any way I can get back the papers I had in it?"No, of course not--not unless the thief is caught and what he stole returned to you.Or unless you have them backed up somewhere, but your question makes it sound like you don't. So for the future, let me give you my standard advice on backing up:Almost everyone should be backing up to external media regularly. It is always possible that a hard drive crash, user error, nearby lightning strike, virus attack, even theft of the computer, can cause the loss of everything on your drive. As has often been said, it's not a matter of whether you will have such a problem, but when.

I kept receiving the error, this cant be installed at this time contact your sys admin blah blah blah. I quickly found out its because of this stupid Windows 10 "S-Mode". Either the icon will do nothing or I get a message saying that icon to an app, but that's impossible because I somehow don't have the ability to make that happen - even though I am the admin. I cant even run commands in a terminal! I attempt to reg-edit and get the windows s-mode "no, no" screen again.To summarize: 1. Need to get out of S-Mode2. Im not able to access the store in order to get out of S-Mode3. Cant access reg-edit or run terminal commands 4. If you need to know its an HP Stream laptop

windows.symptom: Audio jack doesnt detect my headphones?        I mainly use Bluetooth headphones or headphones that go into a usb port and it works perfectly . But I got a new pair of headphones and when I try to plug them into the audio jack in the front and back it does not work (these headphones also have a audio plugin for a microphone). I've tried looking at my drivers and it says they are all up to date but i'm still having problems.
solutions: Hey there helena, Evan here an independent adviser here to assist you. It could be that your PC is still looking for your old headphones. Please right-click the speaker icon on your desktop.Let click sound settings and in the settings window that pops up please navigate to sound control panel. A second window will open and then please click Playback.When you have your headphones plugged in you should be able to select them via right-click and left-click the option to set as default audio device.Please let me know if this helps!

Hello, my name is Arif Ahmed, Windows Advisor. I would be happy to help you. If the camera is not recognizing your face due to small changes, I would suggest you to kindly remove existing face ID and add your current face ID.

Alright, please try the following method: Open gpedit.msc Navigate to Policy > Administrative Templates > Windows Components > Windows Hello for BusinessSelect Use Windows Hello for Business Select the disable option Click Apply Click OK

Okay, please create a Local Account and check if the Hello feature works or not.
I signed in with a local account and nothing has changed.

windows.symptom: Maximized windows on left display has serious problems        Windows 10.  Two monitors.  The left (monitor 2) is set as "main".  In this display, windows that are maximized - with explorer or any other app - has the following "features":1) The top part of the window (about 1 cm) is black.  The top left corner is also a black rectangle about 2x2 cm.  The top right corner is a black rectangle about 2 cm high x 8 cm long:2) If you try to click or double click in the black area - for example, to close the window - or use the min max buttons or the upper left corner window menu system - the click(s) affect the underlying items.  (eg: if there is a desktop item there - like the trashcan - it will open on double-click.)  It behaves like the areas in black are "transparent" to the underling environment.3)  Therefore, you cannot min/max via window buttons; only though the taskbar menu system: but only if it is available.4)  This problem does not occur in my right (monitor 1) window.I have tried restarting.  I have done a sfc /scannow, as well as DISM CheckHealth/ScanHealth/RestoreHealth: no issues.  I have not installed any new software anytime recently.  The problem started yesterday.  It is a surprisingly debilitating issue:  I've had to resort to only using my right monitor.
solutions: If you physically swap the cables round for the monitors, does it do the same? Or does it happen on the monitor you swapped?

I'll try that next weekend - its a bit complicated as my dual-display is on a KVM shared with another workstation.  Are you suggesting a driver issue with the display?  A cabling issue would not create this problem.  Note that the black areas coincidentally relates to window specific client areas:  the menu areas, title bar, close/min/max buttons area.  All apps with the same behavior? - meh.  It must be related to Windows calls.  The confusing bit is only one display.I'm going to do a full shutdown as well.  I do not trust Windows "restarts" anymore... they cache a LOT of components these days.
Ah cool. Yes, Hybrid restarts do keep a lot of things still going. For us causes issues with security patching
Ah KVM does throw a spanner in the works. Try bypass it and see if it does the same. I've had issues with KVMs before

OK... a complete shutdown, 10 second "rest" - and then restart, did the trick.  This was obviously easier then mucking about with two PC's, and two displays/cables.... and in the end made the most sense.  (ie: Windows software error that did not properly reset with a simple restart.)I think I cannot advise people to restart their machines on a problem anymore... the advice must be: complete shutdown and then try again.Thanks to those who responded!

windows.symptom: activation after manufacturer motherboard and operating system replaced        Confused purchased new Windows 10 All in One,  first day Blue Screen and "said I had no operating system installed"?  Happened twice both time send back to HPOn Activation screen says  "Windows is activated with a digital license"Half ways down screen under key icon  "change product key"   statesthe last product key (ID:00326-10000-00000-AA405) you entered can't be used on this copy of Windows.  (0x80070426)    I didn't enter any product key     can someone explain to me what this means???Also didn't understand with returned order stated   "apps being used as programs"?????    I don't sync or use programs on my phone except for emails????    Thanks in advance if you can explain or help with fixWhen I tried to restore it said do want to go back to Windows 7....Never had windows 7
solutions: Did you replace the motherboard yourself or it has been done by the manufacturer?Pre-installed version of Windows is OEM and it means it only could be installed on the current PC and when you change motherboard it is like you have new PC and you will need new license.If motherboard has been changed by the manufacturer, contact them and tell them about the issue.

Hi LisaBarber4 I'll try to help you on this issue. There is a lot of different things happening here, so let's break it down : - The Windows licence shipped with a new computer is an "OEM licence" (original equipment manufacturer). It simply means that the licence key is linked to your specific computer, and can't be transfered.- A "digital licence" is a "non physical licence". So you don't have a sticker with the serial number on your computer. The licence is stored in the motherboard.Can you explain further what is the current issue ? I'm not 100% sure to understand.I'll wait for your news Regards

You should also download and install any critical or important Windows Updates.If the issue persists, try connecting the controller through a different USB port, preferably, powered ports found on the back of the PC.Regards.

"Add devices and printers".The controller should show up. No PIN, No connecting but never connect.I have been using the add the device in Windows 10 settings that never worked.Hope that helps.Cheers,Kai

Wow,I bought the Xbox One Wireless Controller 4 weeks ago and have not had any success connecting to my Lenovo Y50 gaming laptop. I searched forever. All the forums and Microsoft instructions are wacked and did not help me connect with Bluetooth.You are right in that the Bluetooth settings did not work. It doesn't show up as an option to pair. Even after all my drivers are updated. I simply went into "Add devices and printers" and bam, weeks of frustration gone!!Thanks for this simple resolve!!!!

windows.symptom: new Iso windows 10 installation disc        Hi i have just had issues doing a fresh install of my windows 10 from my iso disc i made dated 2015 I did have a second copy dated 2017 and this has worked Now i would like to make a fresh installation disc and USB bootable drive but cant seem to find the thread or post from years ago Please can someone link me to; 1, Where to down load a windows 10 OS 2, How to make an ISO disc and USB driveAs i have forgotten how to do everything and all this will be for the next time i have to do a clean install on my PC Thanks
solutions: Hi GT60 , you can reinstall Windows 10 at any time, you will not need a Product Key, activation will be automatic and it will not cost you anything !Click this link: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-downlo...to download the Media Creation Tool (Click on Download Tool Now), with that you can download the latest Windows 10 ISO (Select Create Installation Media for Another PC), you can create a bootable USB flash drive (min 8GB) using that toolThen, Boot your PC from the Installation Media you just created (change Boot Order in your BIOS) to begin installing Windows 10Since you previously had Windows 10 installed and activated on that PC during the installation process skip the steps which ask for a product key and select the option 'I am Reinstalling Windows 10 on this PC', and activation will not be an issue, your PC will have a digital entitlement stored on the Microsoft Activation Servers Make sure you install the same Edition of Windows 10 (Home, Pro . . . etc.) you previously had installed to avoid Activation issues

Hi pictureattacher,Open Settings >> Personalization >> Taskbar >> under Notification area >> Click select which icons appear on the taskbar.In the below list, Kindly turned on for the Windows Explorer "Safely Remove Hardware and Eject Media.Make sure to trust a computerConnect your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch to your computer or another device.Enter your passcode, if you have one, to unlock your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch.If you want to allow your computer to access information on your device, select your device in Finder and click Trust, or if you're using iTunes, click Continue.On your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch, confirm that you allow your computer or other device to access your data. If you don't want to trust the computer or other connected device, tap Don't Trust on your device. If you want to trust your computer, tap Trust.Hope this helps you.Regards,
